papers.title: Which Problems Are Most Likely to Be Solved by Sleeping on It?
papers.preview: Explores the cognitive mechanisms behind sleep-induced insight and problem-solving breakthroughs.

papers.title: Dreams vs. Daydreams: Mechanisms and Vividness Enhancement
papers.preview: Investigates the neurological and psychological distinctions between dreams, daydreams, and imagination.

papers.title: Nightmares and Exhaustion: Tiredness and the Roots of Fear
papers.preview: Analyzes how fatigue influences dream content and the psychological origins of nightmares.

papers.title: Which Kinds of Knowledge Decay the Fastest Without Use?
papers.preview: A comparative analysis of decay rates across disciplines and memory types.

papers.title: What Sensory Inputs Most Affect Our Sense of Time?
papers.preview: Examines how vision, sound, and bodily cues influence time perception.

papers.title: The Collapse Pattern: Sexual Deviancy and the Fall of Civilizations
papers.preview: Explores recurring correlations between sexual norms and civilizational decline.

papers.title: Is History Circular? Recurrence, Collapse, and Civilizational Archetypes
papers.preview: Evaluates historical patterns and the possibility of cyclical history.

papers.title: Do People Solve Moral Dilemmas Differently at Different Times of Day?
papers.preview: Studies diurnal variation in moral decision-making and cognitive load.

papers.title: Do Learning Styles Reflect Intelligence? Correlation vs. Causation
papers.preview: Dissects the debated link between learning preferences and general intelligence.

papers.title: What Study Methods Produce the Best Long-Term Retention by Discipline?
papers.preview: Meta-analysis of optimal study techniques tailored to subject matter.

papers.title: Does Reading Online Train a Different Form of Memory Than Reading Books?
papers.preview: Investigates medium-dependent memory encoding and its cognitive consequences.

papers.title: Do Negative Emotions Outweigh Positive Ones?
papers.preview: A psychological and neurological review of emotional valence and impact.

papers.title: Is Life a Gift or a Curse? A Quantified Point of View
papers.preview: Evaluates the existential balance sheet of pleasure vs. suffering across a lifespan.

papers.title: Simulating Human Moral Judgment in LLMs
papers.preview: Constructs a benchmark from human moral responses to evaluate how closely large language models align with real-world ethical intuitions.

papers.title: Quantifying the Perceived and Measured Effects of Nootropics on Cognitive Performance
papers.preview: Uses self-tracking and online cognitive tests to compare subjective vs. objective effects of nootropics on memory, focus, and alertness.

papers.title: Predicting Real-World Achievement from Open-Source Intelligence
papers.preview: Explores whether online public outputs (code, writing, competition rankings) can serve as better predictors of intelligence and talent than traditional IQ tests.

papers.title: Do Learning Styles Reflect Intelligence? Correlation vs. Causation
papers.preview: Investigates the relationship between self-reported learning styles and traditional measures of intelligence.
